info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 8:10PM EDT until June 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Appomattox, Buckingham and Campbell. In south central Virginia, Charlotte. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since 7pm. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bowler Creek, Abbott Branch, Bear Creek, Bear Branch, Beaverpond Branch, Alabama Creek, Austin Creek, Bent Creek, Brick Kiln Branch, Appomattox River and Blackfoot Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible over the area through 9pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Appomattox... Charlotte Court House... Phenix... Red House... Bent Creek... Pamplin City... Evergreen... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
